conclusion: The electromotive force (emf) of the power supply is E = 10 V, capacitors C1 and C2 both have capacitance of 30 μF, resistors R1 = 4.0 Ω and R2 = 6.0 Ω, initially switch S is closed allowing capacitors to charge.
When switch S is closed, capacitors C1 and C2 are in parallel with the power supply, voltage across each capacitor is equal to emf of power supply, V = 10 V.
Charge on capacitor C1 is Q1 = C1 × V = 30 × 10^-6 F × 10 V = 300 μC.
Charge on capacitor C2 is Q2 = C2 × V = 30 × 10^-6 F × 10 V = 300 μC.
When switch S is opened, power supply is disconnected, capacitors start discharging through resistors R1 and R2.
Capacitors are in series with resistors R1 and R2, total initial charge on capacitors is Q_total = Q1 + Q2 = 300 μC + 300 μC = 600 μC.
Since capacitors discharge through both resistors in series, same amount of charge initially stored in capacitors will pass through R1, amount of charge passing through R1 is 600 μC.
